inra.ijpb.plugins

Class GeodesicDiameterPlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • inra.ijpb.plugins.GeodesicDiameterPlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ij.plugin.PlugIn

    public class GeodesicDiameterPlugin
extends java.lang.Object
implements ij.plugin.PlugIn
    Plugin for computing geodesic distances of labeled particles using chamfer weights.
    Author:
    dlegland

      • exec

        public java.lang.Object[] exec(ij.ImagePlus labels,
                      java.lang.String newName,
                      float[] weights)
        Computes the geodesic diameter of each particle using floating point weights.
        Parameters:
        labels - the label image representing the particles
        newName - the name of the image to be created
        weights - the array of weights for the orthogonal, diagonal directions
        Returns:
        an array of objects

      • exec

        public java.lang.Object[] exec(ij.ImagePlus labels,
                      java.lang.String newName,
                      short[] weights)
        Computes the geodesic diameter of each particle using integer weights.
        Parameters:
        labels - the label image representing the particles
        newName - the name of the image to be created
        weights - the array of weights for the orthogonal, diagonal directions
        Returns:
        an array of objects

      • process

        public ij.measure.ResultsTable process(ij.process.ImageProcessor labels,
                              float[] weights)
        Compute the table of geodesic parameters, when the weights are given as floating point values.
        Parameters:
        labels - the label image of the particles
        weights - the weights to use
        Returns:
        a new ResultsTable object containing the geodesic diameter of each label

      • process

        public ij.measure.ResultsTable process(ij.process.ImageProcessor labels,
                              short[] weights)
        Compute the table of geodesic parameters, when the weights are given as integer values.
        Parameters:
        labels - the label image of the particles
        weights - the weights to use
        Returns:
        a new ResultsTable object containing the geodesic diameter of each label

      • exec

        @Deprecated
public java.lang.Object[] exec(ij.process.ImageProcessor labels,
                                 float[] weights)
        Deprecated. use process method instead
        Compute geodesic length of particles, using imageProcessor as input and weights as array of float
        Parameters:
        labels - the label image of the particles
        weights - the weights to use
        Returns:
        an array of objects (image name, ImagePlus object)

      • showResultsAsOverlay

        public void showResultsAsOverlay(ij.ImagePlus target,
                        ij.measure.ResultsTable table)
        Display the result of geodesic parameter extraction as overlay on a given image.
        Parameters:
        target - the imagePlus used to display result
        table - the ResultsTable obtained from geodesicDimaeter analysis
